originContent: ðŸš— **Bench2Drive-VL** is a closed-loop full-stack benchmark for vision-language models (VLMs) in autonomous driving. In VQA part, our rule-based expert model DriveCommenter is used for generating VQAs' ground truth in CARLA simulator (or from static datasets like Bench2Drive). Original Bench2Drive metrics are used for planning benchmarking.
translatedContent: ðŸš— **Bench2Drive-VL** is a closed-loop full-stack benchmark for vision-language models (VLMs) in autonomous driving. In the VQA part, our rule-based expert model DriveCommenter is used for generating VQAs' ground truth in the CARLA simulator (or from static datasets like Bench2Drive). Original Bench2Drive metrics are used for planning benchmarking.

originContent: ðŸ“š Docker support is on the way...
translatedContent: ðŸ“š Docker support is on the way...

originContent: echo "$CARLA_ROOT/PythonAPI/carla/dist/carla-0.9.15-py3.7-linux-x86_64.egg" >> YOUR_CONDA_PATH/envs/YOUR_CONDA_ENV_NAME/lib/python3.7/site-packages/carla.pth # python 3.8 also works well, please set YOUR_CONDA_PATH and YOUR_CONDA_ENV_NAME
translatedContent: echo "$CARLA_ROOT/PythonAPI/carla/dist/carla-0.9.15-py3.7-linux-x86_64.egg" >> YOUR_CONDA_PATH/envs/YOUR_CONDA_ENV_NAME/lib/python3.7/site-packages/carla.pth # python 3.8 also works well, please set YOUR_CONDA_PATH and YOUR_CONDA_ENV_NAME

originContent: # DriveCommenter drives back the ego vehicle after circumventing obstacles if STRICT_MODE > 0,
translatedContent: # DriveCommenter drives back the ego vehicle after circumventing obstacles if STRICT_MODE > 0,

originContent: # must set to true if doing closed-loop eval.
translatedContent: # must set to true if doing closed-loop eval.
3. Make sure you have the correct environment variables:

originContent: 3. Make sure you have the correct environment variables:

translatedContent: 1. Write a vlm config file (examples can be found under `./vlm_config`):

originContent: 1. Write a vlm config file (examples can be found under `./vlm_config`):

translatedContent: *This is a JSON file, so don't forget to delete all comments!*

originContent: *This is a JSON file, so don't forget to delete all comments!*

translatedContent: *Make sure you include question 50 because action module requires its answer.*

originContent: *Make sure you include question 50 because action module requires its answer.*
"INPUT_WINDOW": 1, // frame count of given image input
translatedContent: "INPUT_WINDOW": 1, // frame count of given image input

originContent: "CONVERSATION_WINDOW": 1, // not used anymore, to be removed
translatedContent: "CONVERSATION_WINDOW": 1, // not used anymore, to be removed

originContent: "USE_ALL_CAMERAS": false, // true if use all cameras as input
translatedContent: "USE_ALL_CAMERAS": false, // true if use all cameras as input

originContent: "USE_BEV": false, // true if use bev as input
translatedContent: "USE_BEV": false, // true if use bev as input

originContent: "NO_HISTORY_MODE": false // do not inherit context of previous VQAs
translatedContent: "NO_HISTORY_MODE": false // do not inherit context of previous VQAs

originContent: "USE_GT": [24] // questions which use ground truth as answer
translatedContent: "USE_GT": [24] // questions which use ground truth as answer

originContent: "USE_BASE64": true, // if false, local path is used for transmitting images
translatedContent: "USE_BASE64": true, // if false, local path is used for transmitting images

originContent: "NO_PERC_INFO": false // do not pass extra perception info to vlm via prompt
translatedContent: "NO_PERC_INFO": false // do not pass extra perception info to vlm via prompt
*If you want a quickstart, you can set MINIMAL=1 to run Bench2Drive-VL without VLM.*

originContent: *If you want a quickstart, you can set MINIMAL=1 to run Bench2Drive-VL without VLM.*
GPU_RANK=0 # the gpu carla runs on
translatedContent: GPU_RANK=0 # the gpu carla runs on

originContent: export MINIMAL=0 # if MINIMAL > 0, DriveCommenter takes control of the ego vehicle,
translatedContent: export MINIMAL=0 # if MINIMAL > 0, DriveCommenter takes control of the ego vehicle,

originContent: # and vlm server is not needed
translatedContent: # and vlm server is not needed
### Generate VQAs from static dataset using DriveCommenter

originContent: ### Generate VQAs from static dataset using DriveCommenter
export SUBSET=0 # generate from a subset of given dataset
translatedContent: export SUBSET=0 # generate from a subset of given dataset

originContent: # DriveCommenter drives back the ego vehicle after circumventing obstacles if STRICT_MODE > 0
translatedContent: # DriveCommenter drives back the ego vehicle after circumventing obstacles if STRICT_MODE > 0

originContent: # it will unzip some of the dataset temporarily in cache dir
translatedContent: # it will unzip some of the dataset temporarily in cache dir

originContent: # We do not recommend using multiple worker here since multi-thread in python is not very good.
translatedContent: # We do not recommend using multiple worker here since multi-thread in python is not very good.

originContent: # You can run multiple DriveCommenter at the same time with different subset and checkpoint files to do the same.
translatedContent: # You can run multiple DriveCommenter at the same time with different subset and checkpoint files to do the same.

originContent: "INFER_SUBSET": false, // inference a subset of given dataset
translatedContent: "INFER_SUBSET": false, // inference a subset of given dataset

originContent: "USE_CHECKPOINT": true, // record the process of inference
translatedContent: "USE_CHECKPOINT": true, // record the process of inference

originContent: "SUBSET_FILE": "./infer_configs/subset.txt", // subset file, leave blank if not used
translatedContent: "SUBSET_FILE": "./infer_configs/subset.txt", // subset file, leave blank if not used

originContent: "CHECKPOINT_FILE": "./infer_configs/finished_scenarios.txt", // checkpoint file, leave blank if not used
translatedContent: "CHECKPOINT_FILE": "./infer_configs/finished_scenarios.txt", // checkpoint file, leave blank if not used

originContent: "ENTRY_EXIT_FILE": "./infer_configs/entry_exits.json", // the file which specifies entry and exit point of certain scenario,
translatedContent: "ENTRY_EXIT_FILE": "./infer_configs/entry_exits.json", // the file which specifies entry and exit point of certain scenario,

originContent: // you can create a file with "{}" as content if do not specify
translatedContent: // you can create a file with "{}" as content if do not specify

originContent: "APPENDIX_FILE": "./infer_configs/append_questions.json" // not used now, to be removed
translatedContent: "APPENDIX_FILE": "./infer_configs/append_questions.json" // not used now, to be removed
1. To use your llm api for evaluation, create a `mytoken.py` under `./B2DVL-Adapter`. Take deepseek as an example:

originContent: 1. To use your llm api for evaluation, create a `mytoken.py` under `./B2DVL-Adapter`. Take deepseek as an example:
"your-token-1", # you can set multiple tokens, and they will be used in a round-robin way
translatedContent: "your-token-1", # you can set multiple tokens, and they will be used in a round-robin way
Then our script will call this api using `openai` templates.

originContent: Then our script will call this api using `openai` templates.
"EVAL_SUBSET": true, // eval a subset of given infer result folder
translatedContent: "EVAL_SUBSET": true, // eval a subset of given infer result folder

originContent: "USE_CHECKPOINT": false, // use a file to record evaluation process
translatedContent: "USE_CHECKPOINT": false, // use a file to record evaluation process

translatedContent: // when doing closed-loop inference, this dir is ./output/infer_results/model_name+input_mode

translatedContent: "B2D_DIR": "/path/to/Bench2Drive/dataset", // evaluation script uses annotations in b2d,
